QAPair.Question: What is (are) Viral arthritis ?
QAPair.Answer: Viral arthritis is swelling and irritation (inflammation) of a joint caused by a viral infection.

QAPair.Question: What causes Viral arthritis ?
QAPair.Answer: Arthritis may be a symptom of many virus-related illnesses. It usually disappears on its own without any lasting effects. It may occur with: Enterovirus, Dengue virus, Hepatitis B , Hepatitis C , Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), Human parvovirus, Mumps , Rubella , Alphaviruses, including chikungunya, Cytomegalovirus, Zika, Adenovirus, Epstein-Barr, Ebola , Note : This list may not be all inclusive. It may also occur after immunization with the rubella vaccine, which is typically given to children. While many people are infected with these viruses or receive the rubella vaccine, only a few people develop arthritis. No risk factors are known.

QAPair.Question: What are the symptoms of Viral arthritis ?
QAPair.Answer: The main symptoms are joint pain and swelling of one or more joints.

QAPair.Question: How to diagnose Viral arthritis ?
QAPair.Answer: A physical examination shows joint inflammation . A blood test for viruses may be performed. In some cases, a small amount of fluid may be removed from the affected joint to determine the cause of the inflammation.

QAPair.Question: What are the treatments for Viral arthritis ?
QAPair.Answer: Your health care provider may prescribe pain medicines to relieve discomfort. You may also be prescribed anti-inflammatory medicines. If joint inflammation is severe, aspiration of fluid from the affected joint may relieve pain.

QAPair.Question: What is the outlook for Viral arthritis ?
QAPair.Answer: The outcome is usually good. Most viral arthritis disappears within several days or weeks when the virus-related disease goes away.

Question.qtype: when to contact a medical professional

QAPair.Question: Do I need to see a doctor for Viral arthritis ?
QAPair.Answer: Contact your provider for an appointment if arthritis symptoms last longer than a few weeks.
